abstract.text: A class to coordinate accessory discovery.

inlineContent.text: to interact with the AccessorySetupKit framework.
, and pass in a dispatch queue and an event-handling closure.
AccessorySetupKit calls back to your event handler as the discovery session processes events.
With your event-handler prepared, create an array of
instances to describe accessories your app can set up.
Pass this array to the sessionâ€™s
method to allow someone using your app to choose a discovered accessory to set up.
Your event handler receives events as the picker appears and dismisses, as well as when the person using the app adds an accessory.

Starting in iOS 18.4, apps can use AccessorySetupKit for discovery and setup of Bluetooth LE devices that conform to the Human Interface Device (HID) service, such as keyboard and mouse accessories. The HID accessory needs to advertise a custom service besides the HID service. Add the
to discover the custom service instead of the HID service.

authorizing-a-bluetooth-accessory-PageIm.alt: An illustration of a die over a background patterned with the Bluetooth logo.

discovering-configuring-accessories-Page.alt: An illustration that shows Bluetooth and Wi-Fi devices communicating.

abstract.text: Enable privacy-preserving discovery and configuration of accessories.
Options that affect the behavior of an accessory renaming operation.
The accessory supports Bluetooth Low Energy HID service.
A class to coordinate accessory discovery.
An array of previously-selected accessories for this application.
Activate the session and start delivering events to an event handler.
End authorization of a partially-configured accessory as a failure.
Finish authorization of a partially-setup accessory.
Invalidate the session by stopping any operations.
Removes an accessory.
Displays a view to rename an accessory.
Present a picker that shows accessories managed by a Device Discovery Extension in your app.
Present a picker that shows discovered accessories matching an array of display items.
Properties of an accessory.
Descriptive traits used to discover accessories.
Options supported by an accessory.
An accessory as presented by the discovery picker.
Discover, select, and set up a specific Bluetooth accessory without requesting permission to use Bluetooth.

doc://com.apple.AccessorySetupKit/docume.title: Authorizing a Bluetooth accessory to share a dice roll

abstract.text: Detect nearby accessories and facilitate their setup.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
